qas.question: What is an explanation for the resemblance between disparate parts of the genome?
In which organisms does horizontal gene transfer appear to occur commonly?
Parts of which organelle genomes are thought to have ended up in the nucleus of eukaryotic cells via transfer?
What helps explain why different parts of chloroplasts are similar?
In what organism are eukaryotic cells common?

plausible_answers.text: how there is often extreme similarity between small portions of the genomes

qas.question: What does horizontal gene transfer explain about nuclear chromosomes?
Where do microbes transfer material from their chloroplast and mitochondrial genomes?
What do microbes transfer to chloroplasts?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Horizontal gene transfer<b3_0/><a0_0/> is invoked to explain <b5_0>how there is often extreme similarity between small portions of the genomes<b5_0/> of two organisms that are otherwise very distantly related. Horizontal gene transfer seems to be common among many <a1_0><b4_0>microbes<b4_0/><a1_0/>. Also, eukaryotic cells seem to have experienced a transfer of <b7_0>some genetic material<b7_0/> from their <a2_0>chloroplast and mitochondrial genomes<a2_0/> <b6_0>to their nuclear chromosomes<b6_0/>.
